title: Ticket #6189: add result limit to collector queries
description:
The collector handles locate queries by scanning the entire hashtable for an adtype, it would speed things up if the locate query indicated that it wants only a single result, then the collector could stop scanning as soon as it gets a hit.

To make this a big more general, the query add for collector queries should have a LimitResults attribute that indicates the maximum number of a results desired (just like -limit in condor_history). The collector should honor this.

Also, when the deamon client does a locate query, it should always set the result limit to 1.

Finally, a new argument should be added to condor_status so that the result limit can be set explicitly.
remarks:
2017-Mar-27 16:08:17 by tannenba:
For some reason, the commits to implement the result limit in the collector itself were committed as part of unrelated ticket #6191

2017-Apr-11 14:20:01 by tannenba:
CODE REVIEW

I feel that if the collector receives a query that has ATTR_LOCATION_QUERY, then the result limit should be set to one.

This default should be implemented in the collector itself, for two reasons:

  1. so that older v8.6 clients that actually set ATTR_LOCATION_QUERY correctly but fail to set ATTR_LIMIT_RESULTS still have a result limit of one, and

  2. so that even in the current code, all the location query call sites that this ticket failed to set a result limit upon (i.e. python bindings, several others) also will result in a default result limit of one.

Is there some reason to not have the collector set a result limit of one for all location queries?
